se.starbox.models

Class FileSystemModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.starbox.models.FileSystemModel

  • public class FileSystemModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles requests to get files of the file system from the outside, this includes file download requests and index data file requests. The requests are handled in the sense that either you are accepted or denied a File object of the file you are requesting. Weather or not a request is accepted depends on if your IP address is white-listed or not.
    Version:
    2012-02-28
    Author:
    Henrik Boström

      • FileSystemModel

        public FileSystemModel(UserModel userModel,

        Parameters:
        userModel - The user model to use (for checking the white-list)
        settingsModel - The settings model to use (for checking the Starbox folder file path)

    • Method Detail

      • requestDownload

        public java.io.File requestDownload(java.lang.String relativeFilepath,
                           java.lang.String ip)
        Requests to download one of your files. The file is not actually transfered, but if the request is accepted then a File object will be returned for the corresponding local file, if not then null is returned.
        For the request to be accepted relativeFilepath must correspond to an existing (readable) file of the Starbox folder and the ip must be white-listed.
        Parameters:
        relativeFilepath - The file path of the file relative to the starbox folder
        ip - The IP address of the person requesting the file
        Returns:
        The file requested to be download, or null if the request was declined
        See Also:
        UserModel.getWhiteList()

      • requestIndexData

        public java.io.File requestIndexData(java.lang.String ip)
        Requests to get the local index data. The file is not actually transfered, but if the request is accepted then a File object for will be returned for the XML-file of the local index data, if not then null is returned.
        For the request to be accepted the ip must be white-listed and the file must exist and be readable.
        Parameters:
        ip - The IP address of the person requesting the index
        Returns:
        The local index file, or null if the request was declined
